org.jscsi.initiator.devices
Interface Device

All Known Implementing Classes:
DummyDevice, JSCSIDevice, PrefetchDevice, Raid0Device, Raid1Device, WhiskasDevice, WriteBufferDevice
public interface Device

Device

A Device is an interface to control e.g. iSCSI connections between an initiator and a target. It provides methods to read and write data.

Multiple threads can concurrently access this device. Only the open() and close() methods are synchronized.

Author:
Bastian Lemke

Method Summary

          Close this device.

          Get the number of blocks available on this device.

Method Detail

open

void open()
          throws java.lang.Exception
Initialize this Device, e.g. create the connection from an iSCSI initiator to a target.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if any error occurs.

close

void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
Close this device. Clean up everything e.g. close connections between iSCSI initiator and target.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if any error occurs.

getBlockSize

int getBlockSize()
Get the number of bytes in one block on this device.

Returns:
the blocksize of the Device.

getBlockCount

long getBlockCount()
Get the number of blocks available on this device.

Returns:
the number of blocks available on this device.

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Get the name of this device.

Returns:
the name of this device.

read

void read(long address,
          byte[] data)
          throws java.lang.Exception
Read data from this device. data.length bytes from blockaddress address will be read and written to data

Parameters:
address - logical blockaddress to read data from.
data - empty byte array to write read data to. This byte array must be a multiple of blocksize.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if any error occurs.

write

void write(long address,
           byte[] data)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Write data to this device. All bytes from data will be written to blockaddress address on this device.

Parameters:
address - logical blockaddress to write data to.
data - byte array with the data to write. This byte array must be a multiple of blocksize.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if any error occurs.
